revised_title: Ventilation, Experiments, and Observations at Sea
tldr: Captain Henry Ellis shares his experiences and experiments with ship ventilation, temperature, and water salinity while on a voyage. He explains the benefits of ventilation for the health and well-being of crew members and the preservation of cargo. He also describes his observations of the temperature and salinity of the ocean at various depths using a bucket sea-gage, which he credits for helping them maintain a healthy and comfortable environment during their journey.
